contextId.information: The stone is referred to as if it is a person who can see. AT: "The great stone ... is still there, and people remember what happened on it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The great stone ... remains a witness

contextId.information: Here Samuel speaks of Saul's hand as if it were a person trying to find things. AT: "do whatever you think is right to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: do whatever your hand finds to do

contextId.information: Samuel speaks as if the Spirit of Yahweh were a person running up to Saul and taking complete control of him. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:10:05|10:6]]. AT: "the Spirit of Yahweh took complete control of him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the Spirit of God rushed upon him
